q: the memory of Martin Luther King . Leaving denouncement of his church "sermon" to others, John Archibald tentherism in his inaugural address earlier that day as equally "unnecessary, divisive and blind." As he notes, it was, after all, Martin Luther Day in Montgomery. It was the inaugural, the same event George Will Wallace used in 1963 to wave his "segregation forever' fist at the federal government. Bentley"s words that day "burn like a bad memory," and a worse testament to a seminal American legacy.
